channel.title: shelly virtual on Shelly CLI
channel.description: Recent content in shelly virtual on Shelly CLI

item.title: shelly virtual create
item.description:
shelly virtual create

Create a virtual component

Synopsis

Create a new virtual component on a Shelly Gen2+ device.

Available types: boolean - True/false value number - Numeric value with optional min/max text - Text string value enum - Selection from predefined options button - Triggerable button group - Component group

Virtual components are automatically assigned IDs in the range 200-299.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly virtual - Manage virtual components

item.title: shelly virtual delete
item.description:
shelly virtual delete

Delete a virtual component

Synopsis

Delete a virtual component from a Shelly Gen2+ device.

The key format is “type:id”, for example “boolean:200” or “number:201”.

This action cannot be undone.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly virtual - Manage virtual components

item.title: shelly virtual get
item.description:
shelly virtual get

Get a virtual component value

Synopsis

Get the current value of a virtual component.

The key format is “type:id”, for example “boolean:200” or “number:201”.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly virtual - Manage virtual components

item.title: shelly virtual list
item.description:
shelly virtual list

List virtual components on a device

Synopsis

List all virtual components on a Shelly Gen2+ device.

Virtual components include boolean, number, text, enum, button, and group types. Component IDs in the range 200-299 are reserved for virtual components.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly virtual - Manage virtual components

item.title: shelly virtual set
item.description:
shelly virtual set

Set a virtual component value

Synopsis

Set the value of a virtual component.

The key format is “type:id”, for example “boolean:200” or “number:201”.

For boolean components, use –toggle to flip the current value. For button components, use “trigger” as the value to press the button.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly virtual - Manage virtual components
